laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive for protein (++), ketones (+++), bilirubin (+); sediment contained 50 to 100 white cells, 3 to 5 red cells, and moderate amounts of bacteria per high-power field.
Elevated at 0.21 ng per milliliter on admission, decreased to 0.17 ng per milliliter the next day, was 0.19 ng per milliliter on the fourth hospital day, then subsequently declined.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased from 0.21 ng/ml to 0.17 ng/ml and then to 0.19 ng/ml over the days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Two cultures yielded gram-positive cocci in pairs and short chains, later identified as Streptococcus anginosus (S. milleri group).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Negative results on the fifth and sixth hospital days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Valvular aortic stenosis with calcification, an echo-lucent area measuring 2.3 cm by 0.92 cm anterior to the right coronary cusp, moderate aortic regurgitation, and symmetrical left ventricular hypertrophy.
